metadata.synopsis: The player happens upon a conflict between merchant Arfur Gregorio and the gang he employed (Zenovia Dawg and the Rivington Rats) as he tries to persuade them to get rid of a family of refugees who took up residence in his house while he was away. The player can side with the merchant or the refugees and get paid for the trouble (as well as annoying Zenovia by meddling in Guild affairs).The scene according to the overview doc:Refugee Ben Golewits stands in the doorway of the house, looking pugnacious, while the rest of the Golewits family cluster anxiously behind him. Outside, merchant Arfur Gregorio is bickering with Zenovia Dawg about getting the Rivington Rats to clear the refugees out of his house. Nearby, several refugees watch the scene nervously, including the tiefling, Lakrissa, if she has survived.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Walk up to the group of NPCs by the merchant's house near the start of Wyrm's Crossing.

19.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
19.text: What do you want? I have filthy squatters decreasing the value of my property as we speak!
19.context: NodeContext: Frustrated; annoyed at the player's interruption

196.speaker: Player
196.text: This house looks huge - are you sure you don't have any spare rooms?

46.speaker: Player
46.text: I could help you get rid of them if you like.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: Let them stay or I'll decrease the value of your property by mounting your head above the door.

45.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
45.text: Want to make yourself useful? Do something about these vermin running amok in my ancestral home!

235.speaker: Ben Golewits
235.text: The place was empty! Keep those thugs away from my family!
235.context: NodeContext: Angry; defensive of his family

183.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
183.text: Zenovia, get these squatters out of my house now.
183.context: InternalNodeContext: To ZenoviaNodeContext: Indignant at the situation and frustrated at the lack of action from Zenovia and company

9.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
9.text: Arfur, sweetheart - you paid me and my boys to be caravan guards, not cattle wranglers.
9.context: NodeContext: Cocky and a little patronising; she has no fear of this man and knows she's in the right

155.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
155.text: If you want us to get our hands dirty, it'd be our pleasure - but that'll be extra.
155.context: NodeContext: Sweetly matter of fact - but suddenly hard on "but that'll be extra"

78.speaker: Player
78.text: Calm down and tell me what's going on.

216.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
216.text: I just want to remove these unlawful interlopers from my property!

179.speaker: Player
179.text: I've been in your basement - I know what you've been up to.
179.context: NodeContext: Incredulous (but definitely lying/does know what the player is talking about)

107.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
107.text: I have absolutely no idea what you're talking about. But that does rather sound like a threat...
107.context: NodeContext: Incredulous (but definitely lying/does know what the player is talking about)

66.speaker: Player
66.text: This is a pretty big house - are you sure you don't have a single spare room?

143.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
143.text: Pft, they're like kobolds - you let one in and soon the place will be crawling with them!

11.speaker: Player
11.text: Ye gods, this guy is begging to get smacked.
11.context: NodeContext: Shitty landlord with a highly punchable demeanour. But Karlach is saying this a bit to herself/ the team, trying not to make the situation worse.

214.speaker: Karlach
214.text: Ye gods, this guy is begging to get smacked.
214.context: NodeContext: Shitty landlord with a highly punchable demeanour. But Karlach is saying this a bit to herself/ the team, trying not to make the situation worse.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: *This man's indignant demeanour barely masks a seething anxiety. There's more to this situation than he's letting on.*

228.speaker: Player
228.text: *This man's indignant demeanour barely masks a seething anxiety. There's more to this situation than he's letting on.*

40.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
40.text: *This man's indignant demeanour barely masks a seething anxiety. There's more to this situation than he's letting on.*

83.speaker: Narrator
83.text: *This man's indignant demeanour barely masks a seething anxiety. There's more to this situation than he's letting on.*

12.text: I'm a very magnanimous individual, but this is my home. Either they leave, or I'll make them.

76.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
76.text: I'm a very magnanimous individual, but this is my home. Either they leave, or I'll make them.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: You seem to be a little on edge - are you all right?
1.context: NodeContext: Definitely showing his nervousness; worried the player might know his secret

106.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
106.text: Well, wouldn't you be on edge if your beautiful home had been defiled by such brazen interlopers?
106.context: NodeContext: Definitely showing his nervousness; worried the player might know his secret

36.speaker: Player
36.text: How about you live and let live and I let you live in return?

103.speaker: Player
103.text: In that case, perhaps I can help you out.
103.context: NodeContext: Wary; doesn't want someone else involved

145.speaker: Ben Golewits
145.context: NodeContext: Wary; doesn't want someone else involved

59.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
59.text: Shhh, sweetheart - adults are talking. This is Guild business and we'll handle it - as soon as we get paid.
59.context: NodeContext: Patronising - but firm on the final words follow the - (she's showing Arfur she means business)

169.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
169.text: Enough of this bickering! You - what's your proposal?
169.context: InternalNodeContext: To the playerNodeContext: Snapping; wants to know what's what

31.speaker: Player
31.text: Have you tried talking it out with them? Perhaps you could come to some sort of agreement.

230.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
230.text: Agreement? Why should I negotiate with the vermin who've stolen my house?!

7.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
7.text: I've got nothing to say to them.

112.speaker: Player
112.text: I'll get them out of your house for free.
112.context: NodeContext: Suspicious of the player's intentions (but proud of the motto)

223.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
223.text: Old family motto: never trust anyone who works for free. What's in it for you?
223.context: NodeContext: Suspicious of the player's intentions (but proud of the motto)

29.speaker: Player
29.text: I really just quite enjoy brutalising the poor.

108.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
108.text: I never said anyone needed to get hurt - as long as they get out as soon as possible.

126.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
126.text: But other than that, I don't care what methods you use. As long as you get rid of them - and fast - it's fine by me.
126.context: NodeContext: Frustrated; just wants to get this done

187.speaker: Player
187.text: You're the rightful owner and they're trespassing. I want to see justice done.

81.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
81.text: A vigilante, eh? But you definitely have your head screwed on straight - a rarity these days.

69.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
69.text: Get those criminals out of my house and you'll have my profound gratitude.

197.speaker: Player
197.text: Handling this myself is the only way I can guarantee there won't be any blood spilled.

159.speaker: Player
159.text: My reasons are my own. Do you want to save some money or not?

41.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
41.text: Think you can do it? Fine. Be my guest.

157.speaker: Player
157.text: Let them stay or I'll make you leave and never come back.
157.context: NodeContext: Panicked by the threat but still trying to stick to his story before fleeing

89.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
89.text: Fine, fine - they can stay. Just don't blame me when they turn on you like the mongrels they are!
89.context: NodeContext: Panicked by the threat but still trying to stick to his story before fleeing

77.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
77.text: Fine, fine - they can stay. Just don't blame me when they turn on you like the mongrels they are!
77.context: NodeContext: Panicked by the threat but still trying to stick to his story before fleeing

220.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
220.text: Zenovia - why are you just standing there? Do what I'm paying you for!

51.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
51.text: You paid us to protect you and your high-quality merchandise on the road - and we've since arrived at our destination.

193.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
193.text: As I said - anything else is extra.

18.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
18.text: Ugh, this is the last time I hire someone from the Guild.

206.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
206.text: Fine - here's the extra. Finish. The job.
206.context: CinematicNodeContext: Reaches behind back to retrieve coin purse from inventory.NodeContext: Exasperation

182.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
182.text: Now please show this meddler some of that famous Rivington hospitality.
182.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gives gold to ZenoviaInternalNodeContext: He's not actually paying here, it is assumed he will pay later, but he has the gold.NodeContext: Wry

13.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
13.text: Come on, boys - let's take out the trash.
13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gives gold to ZenoviaInternalNodeContext: He's not actually paying here, it is assumed he will pay later, but he has the gold.NodeContext: A little too pleased it's come to violence

94.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
94.text: My gold - it's gone! Zenovia, how could you let this happen?!

25.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
25.text: We did our job, Arfur. Looks like your eyes were bigger than your purse.

161.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
161.text: Come on, boys - let's go home.
161.context: NodeContext: A little weary by this point

5.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
5.text: This was your fault, I know it! The guards will hear about this, make no mistake!
5.context: InternalNodeContext: To the playerNodeContext: Indignant fury

64.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
64.text: You'll pay for this, you meddling reject!
64.context: InternalNodeContext: To the playerNodeContext: Indignant fury

72.speaker: Player
72.text: I can make these squatters disappear for half as much as this lot are asking.

34.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
34.text: You don't exactly look desperate for gold, but I can't help but admire such solid business acumen.

210.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
210.text: You don't exactly look desperate for gold, but I can't help but admire such solid business acumen.

215.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
215.text: Very well - get the job done and you'll be paid and be in my good graces.

153.text: I respect your candour, but I really don't want to upset my good friend Zenovia - or her lovely Rats.

174.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
174.text: I respect your candour, but I really don't want to upset my good friend Zenovia - or her lovely Rats.

217.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
217.text: But if you happened to take things into your own hands first, well - I couldn't stop you.
217.context: NodeContext: Definitely saying this on the down low

141.speaker: Player
141.text: If you can't share, I will tear this house down and reclaim the land for nature.
141.context: NodeContext: self correcting "my business" to "my home"

86.speaker: Player
86.text: I can always ask the Flaming Fist to mediate - they love a wartime property requisition.
86.context: NodeContext: self correcting "my business" to "my home"

104.text: You want the Flaming Fist poking around my business - my property? Gods...
104.context: NodeContext: self correcting "my business" to "my home"

26.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
26.text: You want the Flaming Fist poking around my business - my property? Gods...
26.context: NodeContext: self correcting "my business" to "my home"

221.speaker: Player
221.text: Look, I know the Guild's rates - I'll solve your problem for half the cost.
221.context: NodeContext: Mild amusement; knows she's right

219.speaker: Player
219.text: I could just burn down the entire place. Then no one gets the house.
219.context: NodeContext: Mild amusement; knows she's right

68.speaker: Player
68.text: They stay, or I will burn this building until there is not a board left standing.
68.context: NodeContext: Mild amusement; knows she's right

224.speaker: Player
224.text: Well, I tried. I have more important things to take care of than squatting squabbles.
224.context: NodeContext: Mild amusement; knows she's right

150.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
150.text: I guess we're all you've got, then, Arfur. Want your house squeaky clean? Cough up.
150.context: NodeContext: Mild amusement; knows she's right

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Actually, it looks like your caravan crew are eager to help out - I think I'll leave it to them.

198.speaker: Player
198.text: Fine - but you make them leave. No thugs. No coward shit. OR ELSE.
198.context: NodeContext: nervous, being forced into a difficult, compromising position by a terrfiying barbarian

163.text: You want... me... to... um, hah. Buggery.
163.context: NodeContext: nervous, being forced into a difficult, compromising position by a terrfiying barbarian

21.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
21.text: You want... me... to... um, hah. Buggery.
21.context: NodeContext: nervous, being forced into a difficult, compromising position by a terrfiying barbarian

47.speaker: Player
47.text: Let them stay, a nearby church may give you coin for the trouble. Charity can pay.
47.context: NodeContext: self correcting "my business" to "my home"

156.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
156.text: The clergy? Poking around my business - my home?
156.context: NodeContext: self correcting "my business" to "my home"

97.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
97.text: The clergy? Poking around my business - my home?
97.context: NodeContext: self correcting "my business" to "my home"

125.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
125.text: No, no - it's fine. I'd rather these mongrels stay, if that's the choice.
125.context: NodeContext: nervous but resolved, this is the least bad option

52.text: Oh gods no. No, no, no. I won't be having the clergy poking their noses around my home.

101.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
101.text: Oh gods no. No, no, no. I won't be having the clergy poking their noses around my home.

139.speaker: Player
139.text: It's always heartening to see a true philanthropist out in the wild.

186.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
186.text: Excuse me? I'm exceedingly charitable - ask anyone in this wretched town!

23.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
23.text: It's one thing to donate - extremely generously - to those less fortunate than oneself, and quite another to give away one's entire house!

131.speaker: Player
131.text: Squatters, is it? Maybe I'd be willing to lend a helping hand.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: Delve into this frustrated man's mind.

208.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
208.text: I can't let them stay here - what if the little brat gets into the basement?

54.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
54.text: I can't let them stay here - what if the little brat gets into the basement?

111.text: You! You cast some kind of fell magic on me!

201.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
201.text: You! You cast some kind of fell magic on me!

149.speaker: Player
149.text: Just a little magic trick - nothing malevolent about it, I assure you.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: I'm merely a concerned bystander. That man standing in front of your house, however...

99.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
99.text: It's worse than I thought - witchcraft.

44.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
44.text: It's worse than I thought - witchcraft.

82.speaker: Ben Golewits
82.context: NodeContext: Confused/alarmed; he's no magic user

100.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
100.text: Zenovia, get this evil creature and his coven out of my house before he tries to curse me again!
100.context: NodeContext: Still outraged but pretty pleased with himself for having protection

226.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
226.text: You didn't hire us to piss about with spellcasters - that'll definitely cost you double.

213.text: Do you think me a fool? Zenovia, that was an attempted assault on my person - time to do what I paid you for.
213.context: NodeContext: Still outraged but pretty pleased with himself for having protection

135.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
135.text: Do you think me a fool? Zenovia, that was an attempted assault on my person - time to do what I paid you for.
135.context: NodeContext: Still outraged but pretty pleased with himself for having protection

33.speaker: Zenovia Dawg
33.text: I suppose you're right. Come on, boys - let's beat that magic out of 'em.

138.speaker: Player
138.text: I hear these sorts of houses always have basements - what do you use yours for?
138.context: NodeContext: Nervous; definitely doesn't want the player to look in his basement so is trying to brush it off

227.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
227.text: My basement? Oh, nothing interesting! Just materials - I'm a craftsman, you see.
227.context: NodeContext: Nervous; definitely doesn't want the player to look in his basement so is trying to brush it off

70.speaker: Player
70.text: *This man is definitely lying - and he's really hoping you don't pry any further.*
70.context: NodeContext: Anxious/insistent that he needs the refugees to leave

128.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
128.text: *This man is definitely lying - and he's really hoping you don't pry any further.*
128.context: NodeContext: Anxious/insistent that he needs the refugees to leave

195.speaker: Narrator
195.text: *This man is definitely lying - and he's really hoping you don't pry any further.*

98.text: Look, I have some very valuable components in there - I need to get that lot out before they damage something.
98.context: NodeContext: Anxious/insistent that he needs the refugees to leave

148.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
148.text: Look, I have some very valuable components in there - I need to get that lot out before they damage something.
148.context: NodeContext: Anxious/insistent that he needs the refugees to leave

16.speaker: Player
16.text: Mind if I take a look?
16.context: NodeContext: Incredulous/indignant (and anxious in case they discover the secret stuff in his basement)

15.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
15.text: Who do you think you are? Zenovia, people are lining up to break into my property - do something about it!
15.context: NodeContext: Incredulous/indignant (and anxious in case they discover the secret stuff in his basement)

93.speaker: Player
93.text: I could help you out with that if you want.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: You left, they took it - it's not yours. Unless you kill them in single combat, of course.

116.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
116.text: If it comes down to such barbaric measures... Well, that's what I hired Zenovia here for.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Relax. You don't need all this space, these people do. Everyone wins.

167.speaker: Player
167.text: None of this would have happened if you had a butler manning the house.

192.speaker: Player
192.text: Everyone calm. Explain your disagreement, and we shall find an accord.

233.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
233.text: I don't see why I should be explaining myself. It's my property. They are on it - unlawfully.

200.speaker: Ben Golewits
200.text: Look, we needed somewhere to live. This place was empty, and it had walls. I've got children, for Tyr's sake.

121.speaker: Player
121.text: Raise an eyebrow at Ben, is that all he has?

42.speaker: Player
42.text: Gesture at Gregorio - invite him to reply.

191.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
191.text: Well, I'm... That's all very sad, b-but I still don't see how -

62.speaker: Ben Golewits
62.text: It gets cold out there at night, Mister Gregorio, my kids will get sick. Please, we'll stay out of your way, we just need a roof.

119.speaker: Player
119.text: Look, time is money - and I'm losing both just standing here. Make your call, judge, before Zenovia makes it for you.

166.text: Look, time is money - and I'm losing both just standing here. Make your call, judge, before Zenovia makes it for you.

17.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
17.text: Look, time is money - and I'm losing both just standing here. Make your call, judge, before Zenovia makes it for you.

173.speaker: Player
173.text: The refugees must go. I'll remove them, if you so desire.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: They stay - and I will smite you down should you try and remove them.

152.speaker: Player
152.text: I cannot make the call. Decide amongst yourselves.

188.speaker: Player
188.text: The house seems big enough to share. Should be quite simple.

211.speaker: Player
211.text: Mister Gregorio's right - your presence here is unlawful. It's his choice if you stay.

234.speaker: Player
234.text: You certainly know how to make people feel welcome.
234.context: NodeContext: Pointed (aimed at the refugees but maybe a little at the player too)

105.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
105.text: You shouldn't have to make people feel welcome in places they don't belong.
105.context: NodeContext: Pointed (aimed at the refugees but maybe a little at the player too)

204.speaker: Player
204.text: Does no one we meet ever get along?

176.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
176.text: Not if they're trying to help themselves to other people's property!

73.speaker: Player
73.text: This is quite a pitiful estate to be fighting over.
73.context: NodeContext: Frustrated/a little panicky; he is low on resources and this house is key

205.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
205.text: This is my home! I may pride myself on my philanthropy, but I draw the line at being a halfway house.
205.context: NodeContext: Frustrated/a little panicky; he is low on resources and this house is key

120.speaker: Player
120.text: Zenovia and I are just navigating a slight contractual disagreement - not that it's any of your concern.
120.context: InternalNodeContext: To the playerNodeContext: Trying to hold it together through growing anger/frustration

142.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
142.text: Zenovia and I are just navigating a slight contractual disagreement - not that it's any of your concern.
142.context: InternalNodeContext: To the playerNodeContext: Trying to hold it together through growing anger/frustration

189.text: Zenovia and I are just navigating a slight contractual disagreement - not that it's any of your concern.
189.context: InternalNodeContext: To the playerNodeContext: Trying to hold it together through growing anger/frustration

137.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
137.text: Zenovia and I are just navigating a slight contractual disagreement - not that it's any of your concern.
137.context: InternalNodeContext: To the playerNodeContext: Trying to hold it together through growing anger/frustration

37.speaker: Player
37.text: You're right, it's not - I'll leave you to it.

165.speaker: Player
165.text: The army of the Absolute is mere days away and you're bickering over property ownership?
